# Linux capabilities
## Problem Restatement
Understand and manage Linux capabilities to grant specific privileges to non-root processes.

## Optimal Solution
Use the `setcap` command to assign specific POSIX capabilities to binaries or scripts, allowing them to perform privileged operations without requiring root access.

## Notes
- Always assign the minimum required capabilities to minimize security risks.
- Be cautious when applying capabilities to shell scripts; consider the implications of inheriting capabilities.
- Regularly review and audit capabilities assigned to files to ensure they align with security policies.
- Refer to the official Linux manual page (`man 7 capabilities`) for the complete and authoritative list of capabilities.
